poem:
**Theater's Thrift**

In the West End  
where dreams wear costumes,  
profits pirouette  
from £45.4m  
to £43.2m—  

costumes, cast off  
on velvet backdrops,  
and the weight of  
grand illusions rises,  

yet still,  
the curtain lifts—  
a dance of numbers  
and whispers  
spun anew.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "West End producer Cameron Mackintosh reports profits dip due to cost increases The producer of hit West End shows including Hamilton, Mary Poppins and Les Misérables saw profits dip last year as cost increases more than offset a boost in revenues. Cameron Mackintosh’s eponymous company, which runs eight venues in the West End of London including the Noël Coward and Prince of Wales theatres, reported a drop in profits from £45.4m to £43.2m for the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
